text:
*HS Search and google search related question:*
I have some pages using a template that if a condition is not met the user is redirected to a different page.
The header of the page that is doing the redirecting has a `<META NAME="ROBOTS" CONTENT="NOINDEX, NOFOLLOW">`

We just noticed that Google reported the url as a soft 404(because it redirects to a URL that 404's)

---

I want to know *if there is more I can do to block Google from trying to index that page as the noindex clearly didn’t stop it from trying?*

My other question is *I don’t want  pages with this template to get indexed in HubSpot’s search index. is there anything I can do to prevent that?*
If you have `<meta name="robots" content="noindex">` it should be deleted from the index
If not let me know which page and I can check
today, is it possible to create custom HubL templates for HubSpot’s New Drag-and-Drop Email Builder?

<@UBRG1R3EW> ~I dont think its possible at this moment to create a template locally using hubl then import to the drag and drog items if thats what you are referencing. Also, i know in the new DMv2 the "HubL" module was removed (though is still shown if its a template that already had it in there when you upgraded).~ just noticed you asked about the email one, sorry bout that, I dont think theres anything letting us build into the new drag and drop email templates yet
I could be mistaken but I havent seen or heard anything
The new drag-and-drop email editor is based on a number of pre-built templates, and does not have access to HTML/HubL right now. <@U24DCSJBE> can correct me if I'm wrong though.
any idea if there are plans to sunset the old editor or add support for custom new editor drag n drop templates?
yeah, if we’re building custom modules, we’re not sure how long they will be valid.
Custom modules are a-ok, no plans to change how they work, they should work the same inside the drag-and-drop email editor as they do in the classic editor.

Custom templates are a slightly different plan though. We have a few ideas for how the integration between design manager and drag-and-drop templates is going to work, and the plan is to get to a stage where you can create custom drag-and-drop templates, but the main thing we're finalising is how the will relate to each other. Right now emails and templates have a direct 1-1 relationship, change the template, change *every* email that's using it. The plan for drag-and-drop is that the templates will be more of a "jumping off" point for the email.

We launched a new website! But the mobile menu stays open when you click on two of the links (they are anchor tags). Any idea how to make the menu close when someone clicks on them? I tried forcing it by using the full url instead of just linking to the anchor. <https://www.radarscope.app>

works fine on android and in chrome dev tools.

I think you’re likely dealing with iOS’s goofy hoverstate garbage.

This article is old but should help: <https://css-tricks.com/annoying-mobile-double-tap-link-issue/>
I'm noticing it on Android, someone pointed it out to me on iOS
You can just add a javascript snippet to close the menu on clicking those menu links. The anchor links aren't refreshing the page so there is no event close the menu on clicking the anchor.
I'm on windows chrome and it's not working.
Sent you a PM with a snippet to implement. Let me know if you need more help :slightly_smiling_face:
